According to |beg_ref_slug|andrew_medium_20180116_hardlinkssymboliclinks|end_ref_slug| an inode is like a datase that describes the file/directory attributes such as metadata and the physical location on the hard drive.

Depending on the type of link, an inode makes the following possible:

  • Retrieving information about the file such as permission privilege.
  • Accessing the file, even if it was renamed or moved.
  • Accessing the file from many different places.
